intro: Cremochilus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their broad, velvety leaves and showy, often purple or pink flowers. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Cremochilus species are often found in wetland or disturbed habitats, thriving in moist environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are considered invasive in certain regions.
